question: Where are the headquarters ofÂ Bureau of Indian Standards?
explanation: The Bureau of Indian Standards was set up as a statutory organization under the Bureau of Indian Standards Act, 1986 taking over the assets and liabilities of the Indian Standards Institution (ISI) that came into existence in 1947. The Bureau has its Headquarters in New Delhi. It has a network of five regional offices, 34 branch offices, 5 inspection offices and 8 laboratories which act as effective link between BIS, government, industry and consumers.
